wikipedia_page.main: Charles Douglas Moffatt (5 July 1870 – 1 March 1953) was an English footballer, considered one of the pioneers of the sport in Argentina, active in the country as a player between 1891 and 1901.

response: Banfield players were all born in Great Britain except the center half and captain James Dodds Watson, an Argentine native born in Buenos Aires. The following year (1900), as there was still no promotion, Banfield retained the Second Division championship. That time the club won the title without being defeated. Key players included the goalscorer Edward "Invincible" Potter, noted dribbler Charles Douglas Moffatt, captain Watson Dodds, and goalkeeper/president Goode.

* Charles Douglas Moffatt: Born in London in 1870, he arrived to Argentina in 1889, being a pioneer of Argentine football so he played for St. Andrew's during the first Primera División tournament held in 1891. He then played in Lomas and Flores before moving to Banfield where he retired from football in 1901.

* Charles Douglas Moffatt: Scored all goals in the 3–1 over Old Caledonians at the 1891 playoff match."Los deportistas más destacados del Flores", CEHRHistoria del Fútbol Amateur en la Argentina, by Jorge Iwanczuk. Published by Autores Editores (1992) - "Desempates en el fútbol argentino: 1891–2008" by Ricardo Gorosito of CIHF He also won the first Segunda División championship held in 1899, playing for Banfield.
